      "text": "

 Leslie is passionate about data, data science, machine learning, and AI. He pivoted from a career in economics, finance, and investing in 2019. That year, he joined Grab as Head of Data Science, Policy, and Data Initiatives and Advisor to the CEO. In that role, he sought to answer critical business and social questions using data and build products that provided relevant insights, such as congestion patterns and creating safer bike paths. He helped lay the foundation for the data science and analytics role at Grab and Singtel’s digital bank (GxS). 
 A�er Grab, Leslie was Managing Director at Great Eastern Life Insurance for Data and Strategic Transformation. He and his team were responsible for enabling data analytics and data science across the organisation and fostering business transformation capabilities to deliver value in areas such as distribution, marketing, risk management and digital products. 
 Before Grab, Leslie was the Director of the Economics and Investment Strategy Department and Chief Economist at GIC Private Limited, Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund. He oversaw the team responsible for asset allocation, total portfolio construction, systematic investing, and identifying critical long-term trends that would impact GIC’s portfolio. He remains an advisor to the government on reserve management issues. 
 Leslie was also at the International Monetary Fund. During his Fund career, he worked on financial sector restructuring, financial stability, public debt management, monetary policy, and operations. 
 He was also Head of the Financial Surveillance Division at the Monetary Authority of Singapore.

## NUS FASS, Faculty Advisory Board – Dr Leslie Teo
![](https://fass.nus.edu.sg/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ab-leslie-teo.jpg)
Dr Leslie Teo is Managing Director, Data & Strategic Transformation with Great Eastern Life. He and his team are responsible for analytics, data science, and driving digital transformation.
He was former Advisor to Chief Executive Officer at Grab Holdings Inc, and prior to that Head of Data Science, Policy and Data Initiatives. In these roles, he helped Grab answer important business and social questions using its data, build productive relationships with governments, and grow its fin-tech activities including a digibank.
From 2011 - 2019, he was Director of Economics and Investment Strategy, and Chief Economist of GIC Private Limited (GIC), sovereign wealth fund. There he oversaw the team responsible for asset allocation, total portfolio construction, systematic investing, and identification of key long-term trends that would impact GIC’s portfolio.
Leslie started his career at the International Monetary Fund. In the Fund, he worked on European, Asian, and African countries, as well as in financial systems and policy departments. He was also Head of the Financial Surveillance Division at the Monetary Authority of Singapore.
Leslie serves on several other advisory boards at NUS.
Leslie graduated with a Liberal Arts and Sciences degree from the University of Chicago and PhD in Economics (Finance) from the University of Rochester. He has a Master in Information and Data Science degree from the University of California at Berkeley. In addition, he is a certified Financial Risk Manager and a CFA charterholder.
[View Faculty Advisory Board](https://fass.nus.edu.sg/about-us/advisory-board/)

On January 25, 2025, we had the distinct honor of welcoming Dr. Leslie Teo, a visionary leader whose career has been marked by influential roles in esteemed organizations such as the International Monetary Fund, the Monetary Authority of Singapore, GIC, Grab, and Great Eastern. Currently, he serves in multiple prominent capacities, including as a Smart Nation Fellow at GovTech, a Senior Director at AI Singapore, and a Board Member at IPOS, Sofina, and Coinbase.

Reflecting on Dr. Teo’s remarkable career, it is evident that his journey has been shaped by strategic decisions made at pivotal moments. His ability to navigate complex and uncertain environments with agility and foresight is something we can all learn from—especially here at SMC (Singapore Mentorship Committee) .

We were privileged to have Dr. Teo share his insights and advice on the topic, “Navigating Change and Seizing Opportunities."

A Passion for Technology and AI

Dr. Teo opened his talk by sharing his personal journey, emphasizing that his current passion lies in technology and artificial intelligence. Over the last five years, he has been deeply involved in AI, particularly in the development of large language models for Southeast Asia. One such initiative, SeaLion, is a Singapore-based project aimed at establishing the nation as a leader in AI innovation.

# Leslie Toh

Practice Lead, Application Architecture, Applications

Leslie Toh has been appointed as our Distinguished Engineer from 1 Aug 2022. Leslie is currently the Practice Lead for Application Architecture and has been with us at NCS since 2020, bringing with him 27 years of experience in Software Engineering and 20 years of experience in Application Architecture. He is actively involved in various industry forums on digital transformation as both a panelist and a presenter. Leslie leads and manages over 140 architects and technical consultants in SI delivery projects across commercial and government entities as a practice lead in Applications.

In NCS, he champions the notation of unifying Day 0/Day 1 and Day 2 for the NCS integrated architecture method as part of the integrated delivery method initiative. Most notably, he was the chief architect involved in the large-scale full revamp of the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) real-time securities settlements system in Singapore, a national critical information infrastructure and enterprise transformation serving 200 subsidiaries and entities across Asia Pacific, Middle East, Russia, and Africa.

Additionally, he is a valuable mentor and coach to technical specialists within his domain. He regularly takes time to mentor young talents and helps them move into senior roles within their domain specialties.

Leslie completed his Master of Business Administration with the Adelaide Graduate School of Business on the Ngee Ann Adelaide MBA Scholarship, where he was awarded the Ngee Ann Adelaide Most Outstanding MBA Student Completing in 2009 Prize. He holds a Bachelor in Electrical and Electronic Engineering (Honours) and a Bachelor in Mathematical and Computer Science, both from the University of Adelaide. Dr Leslie Teo is Managing Director, Data & Strategic Transformation with Great Eastern Life. He and his team are responsible for analytics, data science, and driving digital transformation.
He was former Advisor to Chief Executive Officer at Grab Holdings Inc, and prior to that Head of Data Science, Policy and Data Initiatives. Leslie serves on several other advisory boards at NUS.
Leslie graduated with a Liberal Arts and Sciences degree from the University of Chicago and PhD in Economics (Finance) from the University of Rochester. He has a Master in Information and Data Science degree from the University of California at Berkeley. In addition, he is a certified Financial Risk Manager and a CFA charterholder.

We were privileged to have Dr. Teo share his insights and advice on the topic, “Navigating Change and Seizing Opportunities."

A Passion for Technology and AI

# Dr. Leslie Teo

### Biography

Leslie is the Senior Director of AI Products at AI Singapore and part of the team that built SEA-LION, a family of open-sourced LLMs focused on Southeast Asia. He is also a Smart Nation Fellow with GovTech Singapore and an independent Board member of Coinbase Singapore, IPOS International, and Sofina AG, a global investor listed in Belgium.

Leslie is passionate about data, data science, machine learning, and AI. He pivoted from a career in economics, finance, and investing in 2019. That year, he joined Grab as Head of Data Science, Policy, and Data Initiatives and Advisor to the CEO. He helped lay the foundation for the data science and analytics role at Grab and Singtel’s digital bank (GxS). He remains an Advisor to the CEO.

After Grab, Leslie was Managing Director at Great Eastern Life Insurance for Data and Strategic Transformation. He and his team were responsible for enabling data analytics and data science across the organization and fostering business transformation capabilities to deliver value in areas such as distribution, marketing, risk management and digital products.

Before Grab, Leslie was the Director of the Economics and Investment Strategy Department and Chief Economist at GIC Private Limited, Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund. He oversaw the team responsible for asset allocation, total portfolio construction, systematic investing, and identifying critical long-term trends that would impact GIC’s portfolio. He oversaw the team responsible for asset allocation, total portfolio construction, systematic investing, and identifying critical long-term trends that would impact GIC’s portfolio. He remains an advisor to the Ministry of Finance on reserve management issues.

Leslie was also at the International Monetary Fund. During his Fund career, he worked on financial sector restructuring, financial stability, public debt management, monetary policy and operations.

On January 25, 2025, we had the distinct honor of welcoming Dr. Leslie Teo, a visionary leader whose career has been marked by influential roles in esteemed organizations such as the International Monetary Fund, the Monetary Authority of Singapore, GIC, Grab, and Great Eastern. Currently, he serves in multiple prominent capacities, including as a Smart Nation Fellow at GovTech, a Senior Director at AI Singapore, and a Board Member at IPOS, Sofina, and Coinbase.

Reflecting on Dr. Teo’s remarkable career, it is evident that his journey has been shaped by strategic decisions made at pivotal moments. His ability to navigate complex and uncertain environments with agility and foresight is something we can all learn from—especially here at SMC (Singapore Mentorship Committee) .

We were privileged to have Dr. Teo share his insights and advice on the topic, “Navigating Change and Seizing Opportunities."

A Passion for Technology and AI

Dr. Teo opened his talk by sharing his personal journey, emphasizing that his current passion lies in technology and artificial intelligence. Over the last five years, he has been deeply involved in AI, particularly in the development of large language models for Southeast Asia. One such initiative, SeaLion, is a Singapore-based project aimed at establishing the nation as a leader in AI innovation.

      "text": "- [NSCC Singapore](https://www.nscc.sg/)

# Dr. Leslie Teo

### Biography

Leslie is the Senior Director of AI Products at AI Singapore and part of the team that built SEA-LION, a family of open-sourced LLMs focused on Southeast Asia. He is also a Smart Nation Fellow with GovTech Singapore and an independent Board member of Coinbase Singapore, IPOS International, and Sofina AG, a global investor listed in Belgium.

Leslie is passionate about data, data science, machine learning, and AI. He pivoted from a career in economics, finance, and investing in 2019. That year, he joined Grab as Head of Data Science, Policy, and Data Initiatives and Advisor to the CEO. He helped lay the foundation for the data science and analytics role at Grab and Singtel’s digital bank (GxS). He remains an Advisor to the CEO.

After Grab, Leslie was Managing Director at Great Eastern Life Insurance for Data and Strategic Transformation. He and his team were responsible for enabling data analytics and data science across the organization and fostering business transformation capabilities to deliver value in areas such as distribution, marketing, risk management and digital products.

Before Grab, Leslie was the Director of the Economics and Investment Strategy Department and Chief Economist at GIC Private Limited, Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund. He oversaw the team responsible for asset allocation, total portfolio construction, systematic investing, and identifying critical long-term trends that would impact GIC’s portfolio. He remains an advisor to the Ministry of Finance on reserve management issues.

Leslie was also at the International Monetary Fund. During his Fund career, he worked on financial sector restructuring, financial stability, public debt management, monetary policy and operations.

He was also Head of the Financial Surveillance Division at the Monetary Authority of Singapore.

Based on my comprehensive search, I've found detailed information about Dr. Leslie Teo from Singapore. The search results primarily identify one prominent Leslie Teo who stands out prominently in Singapore's technology and AI sectors. Here's the consolidated information:

## Current Professional Role and Affiliations

**Primary Role:** Senior Director of AI Products at AI Singapore

**Current Board/Advisory Positions:**
- Member Board of Directors at IPOS International (since July 2024)
- Member Board of Directors at Sofina AG (since May 2023) - a global investment company listed in Belgium
- Board Member at Coinbase Singapore
- Smart Nation Fellow at GovTech Singapore (since December 2023) - helping build the AI technology practice
- Advisor to the Ministry of Finance on reserve management issues

**LinkedIn Profile:** https://sg.linkedin.com/in/leslieteo01 (7,000+ followers)

## Recent Activities and Projects

**SEA-LION Project:** Leslie is leading Singapore's National Multimodal LLM Programme, developing the SEA-LION family of open-sourced Large Language Models (LLMs) focused on Southeast Asia. This is his flagship project at AI Singapore, aimed at establishing Singapore as a leader in AI innovation.

**Recent Collaborations:**
- Partnership with Google Cloud on SEA-LION v4 launch at Google Cloud AI Asia (September 2025) - utilizing Vertex AI for model training and tuning
- Collaboration with Sony Research to make AI more accessible (2024)
- Partnership with Google Research (2024)

**Speaking Engagements:** 
- Spoke to the Singapore Mentorship Committee (SMC) on "Navigating Change and Seizing Opportunities" (January 25, 2025)
- Regular speaker at industry forums on AI and technology

## Professional Background and Notable Achievements

**Career Pivot (2019):** Leslie transitioned from a 20+ year career in economics, finance, and investing to focus on data, data science, machine learning, and AI.

**Career Timeline:**

1. **International Monetary Fund (IMF)** - Early career
   - Worked on financial sector restructuring, financial stability, public debt management, and monetary policy

2. **Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS)** 
   - Head of the Financial Surveillance Division

3. **GIC Private Limited** (2011-2019) - Singapore's sovereign wealth fund
   - Director of Economics and Investment Strategy Department
   - Chief Economist
   - Oversaw asset allocation, total portfolio construction, and systematic investing

4. **Grab Holdings Inc.** (2019 onwards)
   - Head of Data Science, Policy, and Data Initiatives
   - Advisor to the CEO
   - Helped lay the foundation for Grab's data science and analytics operations
   - Helped establish Singtel's digital bank (GxS)
   - Remains as Advisor to the CEO

5. **Great Eastern Life Insurance**
   - Managing Director for Data & Strategic Transformation
   - Led data analytics and data science initiatives across the organization

**Education:**
- Liberal Arts and Sciences degree from the University of Chicago
- PhD in Economics (Finance) from the University of Rochester
- Master in Information and Data Science from UC Berkeley
- Certified Financial Risk Manager
- CFA charterholder

## Public Profiles and Online Presence

**LinkedIn:** https://sg.linkedin.com/in/leslieteo01 (Primary profile - 7,000+ followers, 500+ connections)

**Professional Profiles:**
- AI Singapore team page: https://aisingapore.org/home/the-team/
- ITU AI for Good speaker profile: https://aiforgood.itu.int/speaker/leslie-teo/
- NUS FASS Faculty Advisory Board: https://fass.nus.edu.sg/about-us/advisory-board/dr-leslie-teo/
- NSCC Singapore: https://www.nscc.sg/team/item/dr-leslie-teo/

**Academic Advisory Roles:**
- Board member of Pacific Pension and Investment programs (education focused)
- NUS FASS Faculty Advisory Board member

## Key Insights

Leslie Teo represents a unique profile of someone who has successfully transitioned from traditional finance and economics to become a thought leader in AI and technology for Southeast Asia. His current focus is on making AI accessible and practical for the SEA region through the SEA-LION initiative, demonstrating his commitment to both innovation and regional development. He is actively engaged in Singapore's Smart Nation agenda and serves in multiple influential positions across government, private sector, and international organizations.
